div.p: Greetings in Christ. Reverend Father, we received your letters quite promptly, and I had intended to respond to them immediately; but I was delayed by Lady Magdalena, who promised to write together, if she had first prepared certain things to be sent to your reverence. Meanwhile, my noble lord von Wei√üenhorn set out to settle a matter which he had long had with a relative concerning his wife's inheritance, which, thanks be to the most good God, was finally successfully concluded. However, in that place, he was struck by a severe and acute illness and returned home, where he became so weak that we almost despaired of his life. In that grief, all of us, especially his wife and sister, were, as your reverence can easily imagine. But, again, honor be to God,...
